definitions.text: a state at a particular time
examples: the current status of the arms negotiations

definitions.text: an assumption on which rests the validity or effect of something else
a mode of being or form of existence of a person or thing
information that should be kept in mind when making a decision
examples: another consideration is the time it would take

definitions.text: the state of (good) health (especially in the phrases `in condition' or `in shape' or `out of condition' or `out of shape')
an illness, disease, or other medical problem
(usually plural) a statement of what is required as part of an agreement
examples: the contract set out the conditions of the lease
the terms of the treaty were generous

definitions.text: the procedure that is varied in order to estimate a variable's effect by comparison with a control condition
develop (children's) behavior by instruction and practice; especially to teach self-control
specify as a condition or requirement in a contract or agreement; make an express demand or provision in an agreement
examples: The will stipulates that she can live in the house for the rest of her life
The contract stipulates the dates of the payments

definitions.text: apply conditioner to in order to make smooth and shiny
examples: I condition my hair after washing it
